title.narrative: POLICY DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION

description.narrative: By 2018, key education legislation (Education Act) and policies (ECD, learner pregnancy & inclusive education) are reviewed and their implementation strategies approved by MoEAC, which contributes to Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Children With Disabilities, Early Childhood Development, Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2018, appropriate legislation, policies, strategic plans and budgets set up and implemented for improved teaching and learning outcomes for boys and girls (pre-primary, primary, secondary).

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2018, key education legislation (Education Act) and policies (ECD, learner pregnancy & inclusive education) are reviewed andtheir implementation strategies approved by MoEAC

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to support MoEAC in tabling principal and subsidiary education legislations following Cabinet endorsement. IECD Framework was endorsed by the Cabinet and isbeing implemented under the coordination of the National IECD Committee. National Safe Schools Framework was launched and all schools were guided to commence its implementation. | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/12/2018

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) b1a. Availability of strong evidence of successful and cost-effective innovations to improve access and learning for the most disadvantaged children - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - Gender - Existence of quality prevention and response mechanisms to address gender based violence in and around schools - score (1-4), see guidance
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) c2a. Early learning policy and early learning programme including quality early learning curriculum and standards - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - Communities - Development and/or implementation of a national school-based management policy framework with UNICEF support
System Strengthening - Early learning - Existence of national policy, leadership and budget for early learning - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - Education sector planning - Education Sector Plan or Transitional Education Sector Plan developed with UNICEF support available
System Strengthening - Gender - Existence of well-defined legal/policy frameworks to address gender based violence in and around schools - score (1-4), see guidance
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of policies on inclusive ECD covering particularly children with disabilities and other marginalized children
Harmonized ECD and educator policies
Implementation strategies for learner pregnancy and inclusive education policies adopted and implemented
Availability, within the education sector plan/policies of fully funded strategy for identifying, testing and financing innovations in education
'Availability of national ECD policy or implementation for scale up
